meanings.definition: To make more powerful or effective.
meanings.sent1: Adding more spices can potentiate the flavor of the soup.
meanings.sent2: Studying regularly can potentiate your understanding of the subject.
meanings.sent3: Eating a whole cake might potentiate your chances of getting a stomach ache.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words potentiated my confidence like a magic spell.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape seemed to potentiate his strength, making him unbeatable.

meanings.definition: To enhance the action of a drug or substance.
meanings.sent1: Drinking alcohol can potentiate the effects of certain medications.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed a second medication to potentiate the pain relief.
meanings.sent3: Mixing energy drinks with coffee might potentiate your alertness to superhero levels.
meanings.sent4: The special ingredient in the potion potentiated its healing powers.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to potentiate the growth of the plants, making them flourish.
